text: I think I do have an unpopular opinion
okay go for it and this is something I
want to do an episode on I guess the
premise is learning go isn't easy I know
we say that a lot like oh go is easy you
can you can get it down in an afternoon
and I would go on to expand that
learning any new language isn't easy and
it's not when we say learning a language
I think a lot of people think learning
the syntax of a language right like how
to do a for Loop how to assign a
variable and I think that's the not even
the tip of the iceberg it's just the
pointy part on top and nothing else
right learning a language is learning
its paradigms
learning like how it's normal libraries
work it's learning how to write
idiomatic code in that language so and
that's not like you're never going to
get that overnight like that's all going
to come with experience so pretending
that any language is easy to learn I
think does the whole Community a
disservice like acting like you can jump
into a language and immediately write
good code is is I don't think realistic
at least it's not realistic for me
um you just don't know enough to know if
you're writing good code when you first
jump in um so learning any programing
language is not easy learning the syntax
is easy the rest is heart
[Music]
